Package crvs

Class Ops

java.lang.Object
crvs.Ops
public class Ops extends Object
This class provides a set of operations to create and manipulate curves.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Initializes a new instance of the Ops class with a reference to the parent PApplet.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ops

      public Ops(processing.core.PApplet parent, float[] table)
      Initializes a new instance of the Ops class with a reference to the parent PApplet. This is necessary for the Ops class to be able to use the PApplet's random functions.
      Parameters:
      parent - A reference to the parent PApplet instance. This is typically passed in from a sketch using the 'this' keyword.
      table - An array of floats to be used as a wavetable by the table() method.

    • Ops

      public Ops(processing.core.PApplet parent)
      Initializes a new instance of the Ops class with a reference to the parent PApplet. This is necessary for the Ops class to be able to use the PApplet's random functions.
      Parameters:
      parent - A reference to the parent PApplet instance. This is typically passed in from a sketch using the 'this' keyword.

  • Method Details

    • bipolarize

      public FloatOp bipolarize(FloatOp unipolarOp)
      Transforms a unipolar FloatOp into a bipolar FloatOp. The resulting FloatOp takes a position as an argument and applies the unipolar operation, then scales the result from a unipolar range [0, 1] to a bipolar range [-1, 1].
      Parameters:
      unipolarOp - The unipolar FloatOp to be transformed into a bipolar FloatOp.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the unipolar operation and scales the result to the bipolar range.

    • rectify

      public FloatOp rectify(FloatOp bipolarOp)
      Transforms a bipolar FloatOp into a unipolar FloatOp. The resulting FloatOp takes a position as an argument and applies the bipolar operation, then scales the result from a bipolar range [-1, 1] to a unipolar range [0, 1].
      Parameters:
      bipolarOp - The bipolar FloatOp to be transformed into a unipolar FloatOp.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the bipolar operation and scales the result to the unipolar range.

    • clamp

      public float clamp(float pos)
      Clamps the position value between 0 and 1.
      Parameters:
      pos - Position value to be clamped.
      Returns:
      Clamped position value.

    • pos2Rad

      public float pos2Rad(float pos)
      Converts a position from a 0-1 range to radians in a 0-2Ï€ range.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to convert, in the 0-1 range.
      Returns:
      The corresponding radian value in the 0-2Ï€ range.

    • triDist

      public float triDist(float lo, float hi, float mode)
      Generates a random number using triangular distribution between a given range.
      Parameters:
      lo - Lower limit of the distribution.
      hi - Upper limit of the distribution.
      mode - Mode of the distribution.
      Returns:
      A random number generated using the triangular distribution.

      Returns:

    • table

      public FloatOp table()
      Returns a FloatOp which represents a wavetable.
      Returns:
      FloatOp representing the described function.

    • gaussian

      public FloatOp gaussian(FloatOp lo, FloatOp hi)
      Generates a FloatOp for a Gaussian distribution that fluctuates between the values produced by the input FloatOps. The resulting FloatOp applies a Gaussian operation to a position and scales it between the values provided by the lo and hi FloatOps at that position. If either lo or hi is null, their respective values are defaulted to 0 and 1 respectively.
      Parameters:
      lo - The lower bound FloatOp. If null, defaults to 0.
      hi - The upper bound FloatOp. If null, defaults to 1.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the Gaussian operation and scales it between the values provided by the lo and hi FloatOps.

    • gaussian

      public FloatOp gaussian()
      Generates a FloatOp for a Gaussian distribution that fluctuates between 0 and 1. This is equivalent to calling gaussian(null, null).
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the Gaussian operation and scales it between 0 and 1.

    • gaussian

      public FloatOp gaussian(FloatOp hi)
      Generates a FloatOp for a Gaussian distribution that fluctuates between 0 and the value produced by the hi FloatOp. This is equivalent to calling gaussian(null, hi).
      Parameters:
      hi - The upper bound FloatOp.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the Gaussian operation and scales it between 0 and the value provided by the hi FloatOp.

    • gaussian

      public FloatOp gaussian(float hi)
      Generates a FloatOp for a Gaussian distribution that fluctuates between 0 and the constant value hi. This is equivalent to calling gaussian(null, c(hi)).
      Parameters:
      hi - The upper bound as a constant float value.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the Gaussian operation and scales it between 0 and the constant hi value.

    • random

      public FloatOp random(FloatOp lo, FloatOp hi, FloatOp mode)
      Returns a FloatOp that applies a random operation within the range defined by two other FloatOps (lo and hi). The random operation can be either uniformly random across the range, or triangularly distributed according to a third FloatOp (mode).
      Parameters:
      lo - The lower bound FloatOp. If null, defaults to 0.
      hi - The upper bound FloatOp. If null, defaults to 1.
      mode - A FloatOp that determines the mode of the triangular distribution. If null, the operation is uniformly random.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the random operation according to the parameters.

    • random

      public FloatOp random()
      Returns a FloatOp that generates a random float between 0 and 1. Equivalent to calling random(null, null, null).
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that generates a random float between 0 and 1.

    • random

      public FloatOp random(FloatOp hi)
      Returns a FloatOp that generates a random float between 0 and the value produced by the hi FloatOp. Equivalent to calling random(null, hi, null).
      Parameters:
      hi - The upper bound FloatOp.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that generates a random float between 0 and the value produced by the hi FloatOp.

    • random

      public FloatOp random(float hi)
      Returns a FloatOp that generates a random float between 0 and the constant hi. Equivalent to calling random(null, c(hi), null).
      Parameters:
      hi - The upper bound as a constant float value.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that generates a random float between 0 and the constant hi.

    • perlin

      public FloatOp perlin(FloatOp x, FloatOp y, FloatOp z, FloatOp octaves, FloatOp falloff)
      Returns a FloatOp that applies a Perlin noise operation to the values produced by the x, y, and z FloatOps. The noise detail is determined by the octaves and falloff FloatOps.
      Parameters:
      x - The FloatOp for the x-coordinate of the Perlin noise. It cannot be null.
      y - The FloatOp for the y-coordinate of the Perlin noise. If null, the function becomes 1D Perlin noise.
      z - The FloatOp for the z-coordinate of the Perlin noise. If null, the function becomes 2D Perlin noise.
      octaves - The FloatOp for the number of octaves of the Perlin noise. If null, defaults to 4.
      falloff - The FloatOp for the falloff factor of the Perlin noise. If null, defaults to 0.5.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the Perlin noise operation according to the parameters.

    • perlin

      public FloatOp perlin(FloatOp x)
      Returns a FloatOp that applies a 1D Perlin noise operation to the value produced by the x FloatOp. Equivalent to calling perlin(x, null, null, null, null).
      Parameters:
      x - The FloatOp for the x-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the 1D Perlin noise operation.

    • perlin

      public FloatOp perlin(float x)
      Returns a FloatOp that applies a 1D Perlin noise operation to the constant x. Equivalent to calling perlin(c(x), null, null, null, null).
      Parameters:
      x - The constant value for the x-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the 1D Perlin noise operation.

    • perlin

      public FloatOp perlin(FloatOp x, FloatOp y)
      Returns a FloatOp that applies a 2D Perlin noise operation to the values produced by the x and y FloatOps. Equivalent to calling perlin(x, y, null, null, null).
      Parameters:
      x - The FloatOp for the x-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      y - The FloatOp for the y-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the 2D Perlin noise operation.

    • perlin

      public FloatOp perlin(float x, float y)
      Returns a FloatOp that applies a 2D Perlin noise operation to the constant values x and y. Equivalent to calling perlin(c(x), c(y), null, null, null).
      Parameters:
      x - The constant value for the x-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      y - The constant value for the y-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the 2D Perlin noise operation.

    • perlin

      public FloatOp perlin(FloatOp x, FloatOp y, FloatOp z)
      Returns a FloatOp that applies a 3D Perlin noise operation to the values produced by the x, y, and z FloatOps. Equivalent to calling perlin(x, y, z, null, null).
      Parameters:
      x - The FloatOp for the x-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      y - The FloatOp for the y-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      z - The FloatOp for the z-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the 3D Perlin noise operation.

    • perlin

      public FloatOp perlin(float x, float y, float z)
      Returns a FloatOp that applies a 3D Perlin noise operation to the constant values x, y, and z. Equivalent to calling perlin(c(x), c(y), c(z), null, null).
      Parameters:
      x - The constant value for the x-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      y - The constant value for the y-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      z - The constant value for the z-coordinate of the Perlin noise.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the 3D Perlin noise operation.

    • acos

      public FloatOp acos()
      Returns a FloatOp which represents an arc cosine waveform.
      Returns:
      FloatOp representing the described function.

    • tan

      public FloatOp tan(FloatOp fb)
      Creates a tangent wave function with optional feedback.
      Parameters:
      fb - function to calculate the amount of feedback
      Returns:
      a FloatOp representing the function

      public FloatOp tan()
      Creates a tangent wave function with no feedback.

    • mult

      public FloatOp mult(FloatOp op, float scalar)
      Returns a FloatOp that multiplies the output of the provided FloatOp with the specified scalar.
      Parameters:
      op - The FloatOp whose output will be multiplied.
      scalar - The scalar to multiply by.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that multiplies the output of the original FloatOp by the scalar.

    • bias

      public FloatOp bias(FloatOp op, float offset)
      Returns a FloatOp that adds the specified offset to the output of the provided FloatOp.
      Parameters:
      op - The FloatOp whose output will be biased.
      offset - The offset to add.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that adds the offset to the output of the original FloatOp.

    • bias

      Parameters:
      op - The original FloatOp.
      offset - The FloatOp that provides the offset to add.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that adds the output of the offset FloatOp to the output of the original FloatOp.

      public FloatOp ring(FloatOp opA, FloatOp opB)
      Returns a FloatOp that multiplies the output of opA with the output of opB.
      Parameters:

      opB - The second FloatOp.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that multiplies the outputs of the two original FloatOps.

    • fold

      public FloatOp fold(FloatOp op, FloatOp threshold)
      Returns a FloatOp that applies a folding operation on the output of the provided FloatOp based on a threshold. The fold operation reduces the output to within the range [0, threshold], "folding" values over the threshold back into the range.
      Parameters:
      op - The FloatOp whose output will be folded.
      threshold - The FloatOp that provides the threshold.
      Returns:
      A new FloatOp that applies the fold operation on the output of the original FloatOp.

    • fold

      public FloatOp fold(FloatOp op, float threshold)
      Fold float op.
      Parameters:
      op - the op
      threshold - the threshold
      Returns:
      the float op

    • fold

      public FloatOp fold(FloatOp op)
      Fold float op. Default threshold of 1
      Parameters:
      op - the op
      Returns:
      the float op

    • array

      public float[] array(FloatOp op, int numSamples, FloatOp mapFunc)
      Transforms a given FloatOp into an array of floats.
      Parameters:
      op - FloatOp to convert to array.
      numSamples - Number of samples to use for transformation.
      mapFunc - Mapping function to apply to each value.
      Returns:
      Array of transformed values.

    • points

      public processing.core.PVector[] points(FloatOp curve, float start, float end, int numPoints, float yscale)
      Generates an array of points that are distributed along the provided curve.

      The curve is represented by the given FloatOp function. The points are spaced equally along the x-axis between the provided start and end values. The total number of points generated is specified by the numPoints parameter.

      Parameters:
      curve - a FloatOp function representing the curve.
      start - the x-coordinate of the first point.
      end - the x-coordinate of the last point.
      numPoints - the total number of points to generate.
      yscale - scalar to multiply by the y value
      Returns:
      an array of PVector objects representing the points along the curve.

    • plot

      public void plot(FloatOp func, float yscale, int color, boolean fill)
      Plots the curve of the provided function on the parent PApplet instance. The function is evaluated across the width of the sketch, and the result is scaled and drawn as a curve.
      Parameters:
      func - The function to plot. This should be a FloatOp which takes a single argument in the range [0, 1] and returns a single value, which will be plotted on the y-axis.
      yscale - The vertical scale factor to apply to the output of the function. This controls the height of the curve on the sketch.
      color - Processing color int to use for stroke or fill
      fill - If true fill w/ noStroke, if false stroke w/ noFill
